faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions from partners, funders, and community members.

q1.question: How do you prevent false or spam reports?
q1.answer: EcoPulse uses community verification with a 2-person threshold, anti-self-verification rules, and duplicate detection. Reports must be verified by independent community members before being prioritized.

q2.question: How does verification work?
q2.answer: Nearby community members confirm what they see by visiting the location. A report is promoted to 'verified' status when it reaches the verification threshold (2 independent verifications). Verifiers cannot verify their own reports.

q3.question: What about privacy?
q3.answer: Privacy-first: we strip EXIF metadata from photos, minimize personal data collection, and avoid device fingerprinting. We encourage users not to include sensitive personal information in reports.

q4.question: How is data exported for donor reporting?
q4.answer: NGO dashboards include CSV export with photo evidence, timestamps, verification status, and location data. This enables donor-ready impact reporting with verifiable evidence.

q5.question: What's your governance structure?
q5.answer: EcoPulse is built by a small core team with experience in product, community operations, and engineering. Fiscal sponsorship is in progress. We are setting up responsible governance and operational partnerships for the pilot.

q6.question: How can an NGO or civic partner help?
q6.answer: Partners can support community onboarding, participate in verification training, and help coordinate response workflows during the pilot. We're actively seeking pilot partners in Nigeria.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.description: Understanding the reporting and verification process

reporting.q: How do I report an environmental issue?
reporting.a: Take a photo of the issue, share your location, select a category (waste or drainage), and add a brief description of at least 60 characters. You can report anonymously or create an account to track your contributions.

verification.a: Once a report is submitted, nearby community members can confirm what they see. When a report reaches 2 verifications from different people, it's promoted to 'verified' status. This creates distributed trust without bureaucracy.

anonymous.a: Yes. Anonymous reporting is fully supported. We use a temporary session ID (stored locally) to track your reports—not device fingerprinting. If you create an account later, you can claim your anonymous reports.

privacy.title: Privacy & Data
privacy.description: How we protect contributors and handle data

dataCollection.a: We collect only what's necessary: photo, location, category, and description. We strip EXIF data from photos, don't use device fingerprinting, and don't sell or monetize your data. See our Privacy Policy for full details.

photoPrivacy.a: Photos are processed to remove EXIF metadata (which can contain GPS, device info, and timestamps), resized for efficiency, and compressed. We never share raw, unprocessed photos.

deletion.a: Authenticated users can delete their own reports. For anonymous reports, contact us with your session ID (found in your browser's local storage). We're working on a self-service deletion feature.

pilot.title: Pilot Program
pilot.description: About our 90-day pilot and partnership opportunities

pilotScope.a: The pilot is a structured test of EcoPulse in 2-3 Nigerian communities. We're measuring verification quality, time-to-response, and resolution outcomes. We share learnings openly, including what doesn't work.

partnership.q: How can my organization partner with EcoPulse?
partnership.a: We're seeking NGO partners (for community access), civic responders (for issue response), and funders (for pilot support). Contact us to discuss how we can work together.

metrics.a: We track verification rate, time-to-verified, response initiation rate, and resolution outcomes. These are targets, not achievements—we share actuals transparently throughout the pilot.

impact.title: Impact & Sustainability
impact.description: Our approach to creating lasting change

resolution.a: No. EcoPulse provides verified evidence and coordination tools—but resolution depends on partners and community action. Our role is to strengthen the data and reduce friction, not replace response systems.

sustainability.a: We're exploring fiscally-sponsored nonprofit status with grant funding for the pilot. Long-term, we're considering partner subscriptions for advanced features and API access—never data monetization.

expansion.a: If the pilot validates our approach, we plan to expand to other African communities. Our mobile-first, low-bandwidth design is built to work across diverse infrastructure contexts.

cta.description: We're happy to answer questions from potential partners, funders, or community members.

dataCollection.title: Data We Collect
dataCollection.intro: We collect different types of data depending on how you use EcoPulse. Here's a clear breakdown:

reports.title: Environmental Reports
reports.content: Photos, GPS coordinates, category selection, and written descriptions of environmental issues. Location data is essential for mapping and verification purposes.

verification.title: Verification Data
verification.content: Your verification status (confirm, dispute, or can't verify), optional notes, and timestamp. This builds community trust and validates reports.

account.title: Account Information
account.content: Email address and authentication data for registered users. Anonymous users may submit reports without an account using session-based tracking.

technical.title: Technical Data
technical.content: Device type, browser version, and general location (country/region) for platform optimization. We do NOT use device fingerprinting or invasive tracking.

photoHandling.title: Photo Privacy & Handling
photoHandling.intro: Photos are critical evidence, but we handle them with privacy in mind:
photoHandling.exif: EXIF metadata is automatically stripped from all photos, removing camera info, timestamps, and embedded GPS data
photoHandling.resize: Images are resized and compressed for efficient storage while maintaining quality for verification
photoHandling.storage: Photos are stored securely on encrypted infrastructure with access controls
photoHandling.access: Only verified reports are publicly visible; pending reports have restricted access

dataUsage.title: How We Use Your Data
dataUsage.intro: Your data serves specific, legitimate purposes:

platform.title: Platform Operation
platform.description: Display reports on maps, enable verification, and coordinate responses

partners.title: Partner Coordination
partners.description: Share verified data with NGO partners for issue resolution

analytics.title: Aggregate Analytics
analytics.description: Understand usage patterns to improve the platform (anonymized)

improvement.title: Service Improvement
improvement.description: Identify bugs, optimize performance, and develop new features

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing & Third Parties
dataSharing.commitment: We never sell your data. Period.
dataSharing.never: Your personal information is not sold, rented, or traded to advertisers, data brokers, or any third parties for commercial purposes.
dataSharing.exceptions: We may share data with: (1) NGO and government partners for issue resolution (verified reports only), (2) Infrastructure providers essential for platform operation (Supabase, Vercel) under strict data processing agreements, (3) Legal authorities when required by law or to protect safety.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.intro: We keep data only as long as necessary for the stated purposes:

reports.period: Retained while issue is active; archived after resolution

account.period: Until account deletion or 2 years of inactivity

rights.title: Your Data Rights
rights.intro: You have the following rights regarding your personal data, aligned with GDPR and NDPR principles:

access.title: Right to Access
access.description: Request a copy of all data we hold about you

correction.title: Right to Correction
correction.description: Update or correct inaccurate personal information

deletion.title: Right to Deletion
deletion.description: Request erasure of your data (subject to legal requirements)

portability.title: Data Portability
portability.description: Export your data in a machine-readable format

objection.title: Right to Object
objection.description: Object to certain types of data processing

withdraw.title: Withdraw Consent
withdraw.description: Revoke previously given consent at any time

security.title: Security Measures
security.intro: We implement comprehensive security measures to protect your data:
security.encryption: TLS encryption for all data in transit; AES-256 encryption for data at rest
security.access: Role-based access controls limiting who can view personal data
security.audit: Regular security audits and vulnerability assessments
security.rls: Row-Level Security (RLS) ensuring users can only access their own data

international.title: International Data Transfers
international.content: Your data may be processed in countries outside your residence for platform operation. We ensure appropriate safeguards through data processing agreements and compliance with applicable data protection laws, including GDPR and Nigeria's NDPR.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: EcoPulse is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe a child has provided us with personal data, please contact us immediately for deletion.

updates.title: Policy Updates
updates.content: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. Material changes will be notified via email (for registered users) or prominent notice on the platform. Continued use after updates constitutes acceptance of the revised policy.

contact.intro: For any privacy-related questions, data access requests, or concerns, please contact our privacy team:
